author: J14T14
title: LEGO Basic Building Set Trial Size Review
review:
I was unable to find out much about this set online. I got it used from my great Aunt's children, so I don't know where they got it. On the box, it says that it is a LEGO® Basic set that is a "Special Trial Size Offer." I am not sure what that means. Brickset says that it was a normal retail set from 1989, so I don't know it this set was only out for a limited time like the LEGO City 3222 Helicopter and Limousine set or if it was just a marketing scheme to sell the set.

Anyway, the set came with 44 bricks and pieces that kids could build anything with, much like today's LEGO Classic set. The best pieces in my opinion were the old propeller and helicopter tail rotor holder pieces. I also like th less common yellow 1 x 2 printed brick with Three-Dot Face Pattern. The rest of the pieces are more common pieces that you can find in other sets.

This set, being a basic set, has some build suggestions on the box for younger kids who are just getting into the system bricks. It is a god set in that aspect and is a good set for older builders wanting to gt more common pieces.
